description:
Not just friendly, but dog and disability friendly!  Wide front entrance (no automatic door), clear large menu sign, lots of interior space, tables are easy to access.  

Excellent fries are fresh made from whole potatoes.  Simple burger and hot dog menu, including veggie burger and salads.  But it's a burger joint, so have the burger!  Good prices for Valencia street, quiet, fast service, very clean, staff will go out of their way for you, sports on TV with the sound off.  Right across from Mission Park if you feel like to-go.

Great place for an easy lunch for all.
author: SF Disability Awareness N.

description:
We stumble upon this place to watch the warriors game. The only reason I am taking the time to write a review is because the girl working the register. 

I spend all weekend in SF and had made up my mind that people are not very friendly. We actually had some very good meals at expensive restaurant and they all had bad customer service. 

This place thou, was the best customer service we saw all weekend. The girl knew the regulars by name, made reccomendations, smiled. The gentleman making the burgers, when he was not cooking he made time to clean the place. 

The food is average, but this place is definitely worth supporting due to the thoughtfulness of the staff.
author: Saidy C.

description:
Great pitstop in the Mission for a filling lunch at a reasonable price. Very focused menu. I usually visit during off-prime lunch hour times, so the restaurant is fairly quiet. Even then 1/3 lb burger is big, fat and juicy. If I've been good, I'll treat myself to the bacon cheeseburger. The sweet potato fries tasted a little burnt. Maybe an oil change is needed. 

UPDATE: Tried the hot dog today. Giant bun, regular ole Oscar Meyer, standard-issue wiener. Nine bucks should at least get you Ball Park Frank-sized wiener. Instead: Mouthful of bread with barely a taste of meat in each bite. Very dissatisfied.
author: Tony B.

description:
The Burger in San Francisco is a challenge, particularly on this side of town. 

There is no Apple Pan. There is no Five Guys. The nearest Super Duper is simply too far from where I live. There is nothing particularly noteworthy or hearty to go to over here on the South side of town.  

Sadly, the Burger Joint is just adequate. It's the best of a bad lot, I'm afraid (though Big Mouth, while different, is okay, too). The burger tastes fresh, but it is too simple, with a bun that's apt to get soggy and fries that are nothing special. The meat is straightforward. 

I really miss Chez Maman that was on Cortland. Their burger isn't cheap enough, but it was fantastic. Sigh.
author: Brent D.

description:
Good spot, good vibes, good music, and good food. Straight forward proper burger. Do not skip out on the bacon! They crisp the bacon up proper. *insert Homer drool gif* 
My go to is a mini bacon cheeseburger. Fries are good and taste fresh cut. My dude likes their sweet potato fries. He tried the chicken sammich and said it was good but prefers their bacon cheeseburger more. Oh! They also have Barq's root beer so that's hella a win. 
This spot is totally our go to for burgers in the Mission.
author: Jenise B.

description: Stumbled into burger joint while looking for a casual place to eat with friends in the Valencia. Was immediately greeted by the cashier who was incredibly friendly and helpful while we ordered, when we were served, and on our way out. Haven't written a review in months on here but felt the need to after today's great experience. Good to know impeccable service like this is still around!
author: Vicky O.

description:
This is my local go to burger joint. It reminds me of the backyard burger you get served by the pool as a kid. It always hits the spot. The vibe makes me laugh too. It's like tacky / diner esque. 

$12 for a good sized burger and fries. Can't beat that in SF. 

Also -
I prefer this place over Wes'. They over salt their meat.
author: Vanessa W.

description:
2 starts for the burger. The thick cut fries were of extremely poor quality with no flavor. When I walked in, I absolutely disrupted the cashier from texting, it was that kind of vibe. Really wasted $15 here. 
BTW when a Yelp business is unclaimed you know they just don't give AF.
author: Richard V.

description:
I have not been at this particular Burger Joint location, but I have been to their location near AT&T Park before they closed it.  If their quality of food is as good as the one that was near the ballpark, it deserves 5+ stars.  Hands down, they make the BEST burgers I have EVER tasted.  No one comes close, which is why I was surprised they closed a couple of their restaurants.

I had thought the chain closed completely.  I was happy to learn that there was one open on Valencia in San Francisco.  I'm looking forward to taking my family there very soon.  My kids also loves their burgers and fries.

Their burgers are so juicy, tasty and very fresh from their bun to the toppings.  Their burgers are also big so be sure to starve yourself before going there.  You won't regret it.
author: Ken K.

description: The employees are extremely rude & act like I was an inconvenience coming in to order. Like, excuse me? Completely ruined the experience for my first time being here. There are a million other places to eat in SF- don't waste your time or money coming here for overpriced burgers.
author: Leesii K.

description: After a bad experience elsewhere, we went here 7/29/10 , Thursday around 10:45pm... The menu has expanded and damn, the burger, ordered to go, was just faboulous! No grease on the paper! Sweet potato fries just great!! Kudos to the chef!!! Just wonderful!
author: Keri B.

description: Really good hamburger. One of the best I have tried in San Francisco. Though fries wasn't my favorite. Chocolat shake is very good too. Will come back.
author: Erick V.

description:
Entering burger joint for the first time today at 12pm. (Guy that didn't put the amount on receipt with the suit)

Feels like I stepped in a time machine where they have funky 80s furniture and music playing in the back ground. The decoration on the wall has a lot of comic art on the wall. This place isn't too busy there are tables and solo seating (35 worth of seating). I finish ordering and the burger isn't as pleasing as it looks or taste. I asked what's usually good here? The cashier with the nose ring gave me a non enthusiastic reply of "oh the cheese burger are good obviously" 

I end up getting a bacon cheese burger with no mayo or ketchup with fries totaling at $13. After waiting not to long about 8mins my order arrived.

 The meat feels dry and no flavor and guess what they didn't even add my bacon I ordered. I end up leaving after taking 2 bites of my burger and ate 4 pieces of fries (which I have to say is also no flavor and poorly selected for freshness). Due to 1 I felt like the atmosphere was not pleasing to eat and lost my appetite. 2. The order was not correct (missing bacon and told her no onions but still placed it on the plate). 3. Only 3 customer in the restaurant can't even make me feel welcome. 

Overall: DONT GO here please it's really mediocre. The burger is bland, employees don't want to work there. And your money is worth being spent elsewhere. 

OWNER: hopefully you don't charge my card ending in xxx4. For $13 at 12 noon March 7, 2016 I will summit a charge back. Thank you.
author: Ken S.

description: The burgers here are amazing!!! The meat was so tasty, no need for all kinds of extra toppings to make up for a tasteless meat. Had there fries and where crispy so yummy. Highly recommend this cute spot!
author: Claudia A.

description: I got food poisoning after eating at Burger Joint this past Friday. Hadn't eaten anything else from anywhere else that day that could've been the culprit, but was vomiting and nauseous all day yesterday, a bit better now. I had the chicken sandwich with salad and sweet potato fries. A friend said she'd also gotten sick after eating there. I don't usually review places, but - diners beware.
author: Brooke Ray S.

description:
FOOD COMA after eating their packed, juicy burgers, thickly sliced fries and drinking their strawberry milkshake!  

Their burger was SO BOMB - I got grilled onions, added loads of mustard and ate pickles with each bite I took of the burger! Yes, that is my style of eating burgers and I loved how it was all so messy!

I prefer their thickly sliced up fries just because it isn't as greasy compared to those thin ones!

That strawberry milkshake was so smooth and had bits of actual strawberries meshed into the shake!  It really complimented the whole burger and fries as a fulfilling meal!

What a yummy, heavy meal that I knew that I would regret eating during lunch, but I devoured everything anyways!
author: Tiffany D.

description: I'd rather go to super duper. It's cheaper for one. The average burger is $15 not including the fries or drink. The food was ehhhhh a 7.5. I was expecting more for that price.
author: Sean V.

description: I'd only been here once before and the previous experience was pretty good, so I had high expectations for my second visit at Burger Joint. And they exceeded my expectations! It's got a really nice old diner type feel to it, with polite and courteous staff. As for the food, this was my first time ordering the grilled chicken breast (with a side salad) and I absolutely loved it, it was filling and tasted great. Definitely looking forward to my next visit.
author: Sami M.

description: I was hungry and this was the only place without a crowd of people . Now I see why ... 3 stars for customers service .. Burger was greasy and bun not toasted so the grease made it soggy .fries had a strange taste .
author: Terry C.

description:
I like the place but second time coming in for take out I didn't have such a good experience. I always like to get a hello out of people, specially when I'm paying up the butt for a burger. Frankly the McDonald's on 24th had friendlier staff, but hey, whatever it's take out. Last time I went, payed about 35$ for two burgers and a shake. Being an old diner employee I can tell you that milkshake was mostly just milk. Also, I'm not a big fan of pink, I like my stuff medium well, but upon returning home and taking a few bites, I noticed my burger patty was straight up burnt solid on the sides . I'm not a complainer, if I find a hair or something I just brush it off, but over ten bucks for burger that I thought was made of charcoal? Meh. Not a fan. 

On the bright side,  I gotta say it's got a good atmosphere, and the portions are big. It's pretty good stuff when it's not overcooked, but it's the price that gets me. It is after all just a burger, next time I plan on just making some at home my way and save myself the nightmare of finding parking there. Milkshakes are just milk and ice cream anyways too. :/
author: Danny B.

description: This place serves up a simply nice burger fresh off the grill  custom made Juicy and not over cooked. Fries are natural cut think In and Out only not soggy as sheet. I think it's a great burger at a fair price . I visited the airport location so the price is a bit higher but still not disappointed  at all.
author: James C.

description:
Burger Joint is a solid, no-frills place to get a burger. If you've been to a diner, you know exactly what's on the menu: burgers, fries, shakes, all that fun stuff.

The burgers themselves have a lot of salt/sodium in them and don't really pack a lot of flavor, but you get a good amount of food for $9ish dollars.
author: Casey S.

description: Love this place! Probably one of my favorite places to grab a burger. I love how there usually aren't too many people in there and I never have to wait in a line. I've always enjoyed my experiences here. The burgers are always cooked perfectly and I really like their lemonade.
author: Lisa M.

description: Aw, how disappointing. An $11 burger should be good, but not at this place. Instead of thick and juicy, it was thin and not much better than frozen. Fries weren't good either. I'll have to not go back.
author: Jay V.

description: Really solid place and if you want to feed two for around $25, it's extremely solid. No frills. Just a Neiman beef patty, fresh tomatoes, etc and nice fresh cut fries. I was very pleased!
author: Brian B.

description: This place is great. Their hamburgers are delicious -- I particularly enjoy ordering a double patty because the meat is so good. I like that they're open a bit later than some of the surrounding places, and they just put in a big TV for watching sports games. It never disappoints me, and it's my go-to burger place.
author: Guru K.

description:
Who wants a poorly executed hamburger with a side of cross-contamination, refuse in the shared utensil bins and a current inspection (4/12) with a rating of 100?  

One hundred percent CAT'S BREATH.  Gold Medal Olympic Winning Cat's Breath.  Climb up onto one of your tables with your mucky clogs while your culinary anthem is played - just don't sing the lyrics - please!

Grandpa Niman, I love you and the family, but Burger Joint is abusing your good name and product. 

The Dudette cannot abide.

http://bit.ly/MAowEk
http://bit.ly/OIKymj
http://bit.ly/SMuv86
http://bit.ly/PomDWK

Beloved Cadet: even with a full suit, this is the Hurt Locker for your gastrointestinal tract and will haunt you endlessly.  

Beloved S.E.A.L. Team 6, do not ever attempt this Mission.

Bleeew-yaaaakkkk.
author: Kim D.

description:
Okay food. Nothing outstanding. Food OK. Service OK. Prices OK. 
I like the fact that its been always sort of empty whenever i go so i can get a good table.
author: Gabriel G.

description: $10 for a big burger with fresh toppings and fries/or salad. Foods good. Ordered burgers, turkey burger, fries, salad and sweet potato fries. Old school Diner type with chrome tables. Would come again.
author: Azizi P.

description: Great vegan burger. Succulent sweet potato fries and all the staples of a burger joint.
author: Analizabeth D.

description: Man..a turkey burger with cheese (no add ons) came out to $14.14. You would expect a 14 dollar burger to be amazing right? Nah. This burger tasted like something you make on your kitchen stove in 15 minutes while you're on the go. Weak flavor. The French fries also tasted like paper. Never coming back, sadly.
author: Sepehr A.

description:
Only came here because we wanted to try Rhea's deli across the street, only to find out it was closed.  We were starving, so we gave this place a try since it closes at 11pm.

It's good, but I find pricey for a burger.  I got a $9 something philly cheesesteak that came with friends, but no drink? Kind of a rip off if you ask me.  They just gave water that was free.  The cheesesteak was good, but nothing amazing.  Fries were too thick.  Only had one bathroom in the back which was not very presentable.  This place wasn't that great.  I'd eat somewhere else and spend $10 on better food.
author: Raquel Y.

description: Cashier should get a new job. If only the owner saw how miserable and incompetent she is, she'd be gone for sure.
author: Evan M.

description:
We came here on a Sunday afternoon when we're used to late lunch crowds packing nearby Curry Up Now!, Mission Cheese, Craftsman & Wolves, etc. (think Hipster Alley On Sunday Fire). So coming to this casual, only partially-full spot with inexpensive, ample and wholesome fare was such a relief! We both got turkey burgers that were incredibly tasty served on adequate wheat buns and large sides of salad (or fries if you eat like the hubs). 

The staff was super courteous and we had a huge window table to watch the action on Valencia while we took our time with our burgers. Definitely a great stand-by when you want to avoid the crowds and headiness of Valencia Street but still take it on in an ambient fashion.
author: Diane B.

description: Delicious burger and great service. So much flavor and the french fries were even better. Try this place out for sure when you are nearby.
author: Jennifer R.

description: Expensive so-so burger. Even the Niman-Ranch meat can't save it, the bun and goes-withs are just too Mel's Drive-In. I was the only person there and they didn't even melt the cheese on my burger, it was hard and flaky. The fries are not good - way too big cut means doughy with no flavor, the shake wasn't creamy enough, the list goes on. It's just too much money for what you get, if it had been under $10 total then I'd give it a 3, but at almost $20 it's not cutting it.
author: Rob C.

description:
Much improved service and presence in this location. Had a collection of excellent burgers and shakes. Kids at all their food and enjoyed themselves. I remember the cook from before and he did a great job this go around. The cashier ran the front of the house efficiently and politely. 

Vastly improved and happy to see it!
author: J S.

description:
I really love coming to BJ. 

Although it's a no frills kinda place, it satisfies my craving for something hot off the grill that isn't a greasy spoon. 

I can only attest to their chicken sandwich/burger, which was grilled perfectly and was fresh and juicy in a non-salmonella-y way. All the fixins added to a great late night dinner. Added cheese and it was probably one of the better chicken sandwich/burgers I've ever had. Good portion. 

The fries weren't anything great, I kinda expected more what with the great chicken burger-wich and all. Got a good heap, though. Sodas are refillable, so there's that.

The counter girl seemed pretty pissed to be working there. Not really sure why--it wasn't packed, or even busy, but she was NOT happy to be there. Sorry, sister friend, we all gotta do what we gotta do to earn the mighty dollar. Cheer up.

Whatever. I'll keep on comin' back.
author: Bianca U.

description:
Great burgers.  Efficient staff.  Large tables.  Quiet.

Who could ask for anything more.
author: Russell b.

description:
Not bad, but nothing to write home about. The burger was kind of sad looking, the fries weren't even craving worthy. In a city of niche burger joints this place doesn't even stand up to a cafe sandwich made in a toaster oven.

Prices are reasonable but for a few dollars more I could have spectacular organic burgers and house-made milk shakes from several other SF burger joints..
author: Dani D.

description:
Burger Joint's burger is decent, and will fit the bill if you are passing by and say to yourself, "Hey self, are you up for a burger right now? And maybe a shake?" In that case, you and yourself and anyone else with you should go inside and eat that burger, shake, and fries. One the two nights I've eaten there, a variety of folks from the Mission, and at least one table of tourists, have done just that.

But if anyone, including yourself, says, "Hmm, maybe not a burger. I might want something else" then you and yourself and anyone else with you should go somewhere else. The burgers at this joint won't win over everyone.

You'll see Niman Ranch featured on the menu, hanging prominently above the register. You'll see a good mix of toppings and flavors, with prices indicative of quality. However, if you're like me, you'll still only like, not love, the burger and fries. Their flavors weren't everything I'd expected.
author: Mike H.

description:
Burger Joint has been one of my regular haunts since I moved to the mission almost 20 years ago. This solidified during the mad cow disease scare in the early 2000s, when I gave up beef but then made exceptions if I could find it from Niman Ranch or Marin Sun Farms. Burger Joint's posted menu says their hamburgers come from Niman Ranch. (It doesn't actually say this for their cheeseburgers, which are listed separately, so it would be nice if they clarified that.)

Some friends who are partial to Big Mouth, 5 blocks south, recently convinced me to give Big Mouth a try instead of Burger Joint. But a visit to Big Mouth tonight convinced me that Burger Joint is quite a bit better, and deserves 5 stars. If you want to do the comparison I did, order a cheeseburger cooked medium on a whole wheat bun, with a salad (instead of fries, offered at both places as an alternative). I usually just drink free water in a cup, but Burger Joint has tasty Juice Squeeze sodas too. Burger Joint won easily. The burger is always juicy and delicious at BJ. It was similarly tasty but a bit drier at BM. Wheat bun is fresh at BJ, but was stale and hard at BM. Salad at BJ has fresh greens and tomatoes, and is available with tasty balsamic vinaigrette. BM's salad is kind of a dry caesar with cheese. And the BJ meal is a bit cheaper in this comparison. Service is quick and reliable at BJ, but I found it a bit slow at BM. Although Big Mouth is closer to my house, I think I will stick with Burger Joint. If you like more menu choices, burgers with different names and so on, go to Big Mouth. Otherwise, you may be better off at Burger Joint.
author: Todd D.

description: Burgers!  Service was mediocre; I know I won't visit this place again-my burger was greasy~YUK!
author: Shirley M. J.

description: they have veggie burgers, they use peanut butter oil to cook.
author: Carmin W.

description: I became violently ill after eating here.  They cook their fries in peanut oil, and I damn near died from them.  I know food allergies are the responsibility of the people that have them, but NO ONE USES PEANUT OIL ANYMORE!!!  Get with the times BJ.  Not that I'd ever go back now.
author: California B.

description: Just ate with my son here: we each had a burger, I had a diet coke and he had a milkshake: $32 before taxes! Overpriced IMHO. Will think twice before coming here next time...
author: Manny H.

description:
Just a generic burger shop, nothing special. Prices are a bit high for what you get. The beef is very lean, I felt very healthy when eating the burger, which is not what usually is supposed to happen when divulging in a big (burgers are not big here) juicy (or juicy) burger. Mostly, I just tasted mustard. 

Recommendation:
Stroll to Cha Cha Cha and grab a burger there.
author: Kyle R.

description: Pretty good burger, awesome fries (if you like steak-style with skins). Uninspired iced tea, if that matters to you. Asked for medium, got medium-well, but not really bothered by it.
author: Jennifer Q.

description: Solid burger place. Service and atmosphere were chill. Girl with the pink hair and chef were friendly and recommended the onion rings. Veggie burger and onion rings were on point and the price wasn't too bad either. Definitely coming back.
author: Victoria L.

description: Turkey burger was kind of bland..but it is my fault for ordering a turkey burger at the burger joint, I suppose. I smothered it in sugary BBQ and ketchup and hot sauce. The side salad was old and disappointing. My friends liked their philly cheesesteaks and said the regular beef burgers are pretty damn good. Prices are on point for the neighborhood, about $10 on average for an entree. Retro diner vibes.
author: Sonya Z.

description:
The food is actually okay, which is a shame, because I will not go back. I cannot support a business that puts customers last.

I ordered a hamburger today, which comes with the standard toppings, including onions. I asked her to grill the onions on my burger. This is something every hamburger place I've ever been to will happily do. Because, why the hell wouldn't they? Then I paid, and asked her how my total was so high.

"It's 75 cents for grilled onions." Really? Yea, really. Sure, she should have told me that when I ordered it. But much more importantly, why on earth am I being charged 75 cents for you to take the onions I'm already paying for and stick them on your already-hot grill for 5 minutes? Clearly the answer is, because they feel like it. Apparently it's on the menu. Your guess is as good as mine, because the menu is printed on a transparent piece of green lucite hung from the ceiling, so I couldn't really read it. That doesn't really change anything, though.

Maybe I'm just sensitive (okay, I'll admit that I am), but it's just wrong. I will not be returning. I hope this location closes just like their Haight street store did. If you don't respect customers, don't go into business.
author: jared c.

description: Food was good, milkshakes were good. It didn't change my perspective on life but the food is solid.
author: David B.

description: Burger Joint is one of my regular stops, has been for many years. The evening of 8/22 I lost my appetite while listening to and watching the manager?owner? berate and bully the staff.  He was particularly hostile and disrespectful to the female employee--just couldn't stop getting in her face and belittling her.  I and the two men I was with were saddened and  appalled.
author: Carol B.

description:
Sometimes, it feels like the only places to get dinner on Valencia Street are 1) obscenely expensive and 2) have extremely long waits. since my housing takes up enough of my paycheck in this expensive city, I was glad to find Burger Joint with some friends for a quick and cheap dinner.

Burger Joint isn't a wild stand-out in San Francisco, but for a reasonably priced (free range) burger that isn't Burger King, they're a good option. They offer vegetarian burgers, sweet potato fries, and options ranging from the healthy to much less so. My food was served relatively quickly, satisfied me, and didn't make me feel like TOO huge of a glutton considering I was eating a burger.

This is a really casual location for dinner (which sometimes is a good thing) but definitely a place I'd go back to for lunch, especially since I work in the area.
author: Denise B.

description: I ordered a cheeseburger with grilled onions to go and it was just a dissapointing mess. the bun was just soggy and looked it was crushed. the meat had no seasoning and was overwhelmed with the large amounts of rilled onions. I just didn't like and I probably won't come back.
author: Mohammad A.

description:
We had dinner at this place last night after we went to Tartine and Dandelion. Our burgers were great and the onions rings even better.
Definitely a good place for a simple dinner in SF.
author: henry d.

description: I threw up as soon as I got home. I think the meat they use is old. I've never thrown up after eating food in my entire life! It was gamey and I couldn't even finish it. I also ordered it well done! In my opinion, something was off about their meat.
author: Camille N.

description:
Great potential, but missing on all fronts

Pros:
Location
Potential to be popular diner

Cons:
Way too overpriced ($11.50) for a tiny cheese steak sandwich. The portion size was laughable
Limited menu 

Went to pick up a cheese steak sandwich the other day and was pretty upset by the portion size and high price. Perhaps there's a reason this place is always empty...
author: Nathan M.

description: cheeseburger & onion rings for under $12, like a magical hangover antidote. delicious, straightforward, simple, hell yeah.
author: Denise H.

description: im a fan good food good serivce ok prices ill be back
author: Leigh G.

description:
Meh, definitely had better burgers. 

Went to this place randomly one night and got a cheeseburger and fries. 

When we walked in you could probably hear a pin drop. It was quiet, no music and the workers were just standing there, staring at each other. 

Thankfully, when we sat down and were waiting for our food, more people started to show up. 

The burger was good, but average. The fries were the same.

I wouldn't go there again, but it wasn't the worst.
author: Saria M.

description:
When they first opened, the Burger Joint was the place to get a delicious burger! The quality grass-fed beef, the delicious shakes and a soda from the fountain to get the real deal coke with that burger to satisfy that craving. Yum!  

  I have to admit- I had not eaten there in quite some time. I had become a fan of Urban Burger on 17th and Valencia, lately, but some genius closed it down and opened yet another taco spot. what were they thinking!? So I walked the couple of extra blocks to ease the burger craving I was having.  

  When I walked into, bj,  the place had a completely different feel to it. ...EMPTY....
I ordered my burger, payed and went to the RR. Then, I noticed a couple of huge bags of PROCESSING POTATOES laying there on a pallet right next to the RR door. In my mind, I kept saying to myself, *They don't use those for their fries!*  Those are the type of potatoes they use for filler. That is the stuff they use in canned foods like Hormel chili and gross stews and even dog food. Yech!!!  They are hideous things, full of chemicals and growth hormones, probably produced by Monsanto. 

 I came around front and sat down looking at the art. The same decor from happier times. I noticed the lack luster staff. Everything started hitting me all at once. I noticed the thick cut potatoes and saw that they fit the length of the ones sitting in the back on the floor next to the filthy toilet. I saw the cook ball up my hamburger in the white wrapper and tie the ends together. my order was up.

I bit into my burger, it wasn't bad... and it was not good. it was a burger without character. Bland. Something I could eat if I wanted and forget about soon after. I tasted the fries. they were even more horrible than I remembered. I never was a fan of the thick cut BJ fries.

I said all of this because I thought it was curious how a business could promote the image of selling organic meats and then turn around and sneak in the cheapest and most gross vegetables- their fries. I guess that's why they're free.
author: CM B.

description: My family stopped in at Burger Joint for a late-night snack around 10:30pm. The service was pretty good, not speedy and not slow. My dad and sister got burgers and said they were delicious, by my mom and I split a pretty mediocre chicken sandwich. It wasn't bad, but certainly nothing special. The sweet potato fries, on the other hand, were fantastic. It gets bonus points for still being open fairly late. I think I'll probably try here again, just steering clear of the chicken sandwich.
author: Tasha A.

description:
i would return. went there on a date at 330pm and it was like i reserved the whole joint to ourselves. 90 degree weather in SF it was cool inside. we had a quiet and intimate time.

caesar salad- overly dressed with tgeir dressing. if only they can put that on the side. 

philly cheese steak- so much meat we split the sandwich and fries between both of us and we were both very filled. 

customer service- good

parking - freakin sucks! obviously bc of the area.
author: Ss S.

description: Outstanding chocolate milkshake. That's all I've tried there but it was incredible very thick and very chocolatey.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Seriously good burgers at BJ.

I also recommend the sweet potato fries.  No beer, FYI.

 It is also located in one of the best spots in the Mission, IMO.
author: Mike B.

description: Really cool place, retro. Good atmosphere. Cool art, too. Well prepared burgers. Not greasy, fresh fries. A little pricey though, but not outrageous.
author: Kelsey S.

description:
Best burger in town! 

CREDENTIALS: I only eat burgers and I make it a point to find the best burger in town. 

RATIONAL: This is, IMO, the best burger in town! I enjoy a straight-up burger; no cheese, teriyaki sauce, onion straws, etc. just a straight burger and fries. The burger comes out hot and juicy, the toppings are fresh, and the fries are crispy! A good no frills burger.

PROS: The burger and fries.

CONS: This place is a chain, which kinda sucks, but shouldn't distract the consumers palet and the atmosphere is not too exciting.

PLUS: The meats are from Niman's free range ranches!
author: Leo C.

description:
Burgers are solid at this spot.  Medium rare is the way to go.  If you're really hungry and bold enough, get the burger w/ cheese and bacon.  forget about it.

fries are solid.  nothing but it gets the job done.  

I only do take out.  service is OK.  clean place.

the lack of menu diversity dings this place to a 3/3.5 rating vs. 4.  also not the best burger in the mission but def top 5.
author: Ivan M.

description:
Tasty burgers, crisp fries, and decent ingredients but, oy, they're not cheap.  The burgers are about $6 - $8 for the burger and fries---not a combo, that's just the way they come.  Milkshakes are $4.75.  So, for no table service you should expect to pay about $14 for a meal.  Though, I think getting a thick 1/2 lb. Niman Ranch patty makes up for the price difference.  Just try the cheesy burger with Swiss!

Times visited: 3+
author: Amy L.

description:
OK. This place aint the Alpha and Omega of hamburgers, but I felt it was good enough for the money. The burger was good (not great) and the fries were good (not great) as well. They ask you how you want your burger cooked and they have a half dozen kinds of cheese to choose from which is a nice touch. 

   The place has a old school 50's - 60's dinner kinda vibe going on which I thought was nice. It had plenty of light and plenty of space; unlike some of the swanky joints on Valencia Street that charge 30 bucks a plate and have you all jammed in like sardines, bumping elbows with the table next to you. I used the restroom and it was plenty clean and well lit also.

   Unfortunately, the hippie liberals have blackballed any big chain joints from building in the city (not like they needed those jobs or anything)  so there are no IN &  OUTs, no FIVE GUYS, and no JOHNNY ROCKETS. So if they whine about this place not being that good or being too expensive (as some reviews do) it's their own damn fault they cant buy a better burger for the same money. Also, it's San Fancisco DUH!! These places are paying OBSCENE rents so they have to charge a lil more to cover that. A similar burger in the East Bay is a few bucks less. 

   So there ya have it. It is what it is - a decent burger at a slightly above average price.
author: Brian K.

description:
Not bad, i had to burn some times while people were having a dinner party for other people that i know/and or care about. So i thought before i tank a few beer, why not Jam on a Burger , it was by where i parked and i craving some assorted ground beef.

No one was in there, so it was cool in a post apocalyptic way, the order came out fast and it definitly tasted like a burger. Nothing really stood out however. I wouldnt go back by choice, but if i was walking past again and still thought the name "BJ's" was as funny as it was first time around... maybe id go again.
author: Sam W.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Saturday afternoon and the place was rather empty expect for my friends and I and a handful of strangers. This place is pretty big for a SF joint, especially for a "Burger Joint," but I would've utilized the space better to get more seating in 'cause there is a lot of wasted floor space. I digress..

The service was kind of slow for being nearly empty afternoon. The fries were decent and the burger was good, I might add. All the burgers come with mayo, lettuce, tomato, red onion, pickles, ketchup, and mustard on the side and you can choose how to assemble your burger when it comes to your table. Oh and they ask you how well you won't your beef patty cooked. I thought that was rather strange, but I guess it's nice to be thorough.
author: Joon Y.

description:
I had a bad day and I reallllyy needed a burger to make it better.

Burger Joint saved the day! The first bite of my cheddar cheeseburger melted all of my troubles away. Sure it's a bit pricey but you are getting good meat (Niman Ranch) and after watching Food Inc. I'll pay a little more to eat something that's better for me.

Definitely one of my new go to spots when I'm craving a burger.
author: Valerie A.

description: Philly cheese steak!!! Yum perfect steak cheese and onion combo. Cool environment and music...needed something cool.
author: John A.

description:
Simple to order, tasty to eat, I seldom ask for more.  It's just a cheeseburger.  Wifey had a turkey burger and says it was one of the best she'd had.  These are straight up hamburgers made with good ingredients.  I remain baffled by any burger establishment that asks how you want your burger cooked.  Burger Joint does ask that rather silly question.  It's a hamburger not a rib eye.  Just cook the thing, not too much, not too little. I did find it necessary to add salt and pepper to the burger patty as the flavor needed a little pick-me-up.

They are traditional lettuce-onion-pickle-ketchup-burgers on a bun.  The fries were good as well.  There are not fast-food burgers.  I'd eat here any time.
author: Kevin F.

description:
I caMe here thinking that I would get a decent meal...I was wrong.  The burger I ordered (and for some reason ate) was terrible.   the fries were bland and boring.  and once again the burger was just this lump of flavorless greasy meat that totally made me want to throw up.  ALSO $11.00 BUCKS FOR A BURGER.  BLEAH!

This place is nothing special and with these types of reviews...never underestimate the taste of the american people...PLEASE GO SOMEWHERE ELSE.  

Also they proudly displayed their yelp sticker.  next time i walk by  here i am scraping it off.  

DO NOT GO HERE.  BAD BAD BAD
author: Bob S.

description:
Stopped here tuesday for an early dinner on my way to school. Ordered a cheeseburger and fries. 

It was okay nothing special. Decent size portions.
Wish the patty was spiced up a bit it was pretty bland. 
I like that they are making the fries fresh so they come out super hot. 
A bit pricey for what it is... I'd rather go to Burgermeister. 

Buttttt overall it gets the job done when you're hungry.
author: Lisette E.

description: The food is fine but don't go during the lunch time slam. It took 30 minutes in line just to order food, then another 20 minutes to receive it. The staff seems overwhelmed and confused. It was clear the young man taking orders to the tables didn't know where to go. He went from table to table to ask what people ordered. After observing this for a half hour, I made my order to go. Even then, he asked, "Is this yours?"  They need a better system.
author: Cynthia L.

description: Truth in advertising: it's your basic burger joint -- nothing fancy. Pretty good turkey burger and fries, but my favorite place is still Little Griddle due to the variety of burgers.
author: Paul L.

description:
Came here after a failed outing to a Giants game.  Horrible rain and we were soaked and cranky.
Clean dining room, a bit hipster feeling.  Bathrooms not disgusting, always nice.
The burgers were great, nicely cooked, juicy, and a great char taste. And, when I asked for extra pickles they did not disappoint.
Also, beer!
The only thing they lacked was that their fries weren't quite my jazz, a bit too thick, but still not horrible.  
I'd go again if the situation repeated itself.
author: Kara R.

description:
I love this place, but just got home after eating with other patrons who brought their dog, dropped food onto the floor, where the dog kept licking it up and yelping and...argh...why didn't the staff ask them to leave the dog outside.

Seriously, San Francisco Health Department...
author: Mark M.

description: Oh Burger Joint, me and your hamburgers and milkshakes have been through so much! The meat quality is superb with local patties grilled to perfection on a slightly toated bun with all the fixin's. $8 for a burger in SF is the norm these days, and you're in for quality at BJ. I can't really credit BJ for their Mitchell's ice cream milk shakes because Mitchell's in and of itself is the bomb, but the dipping of the BJ french fry in the chocolate or strawberry milkshake oh...oh yeah, that's the ticket. Why the 4 and not 5 stars? 2 words: Peanut oil. It just gives the fries a different taste. A not so salty fried taste which, if I've already got the burger and shake in hand, I want the fries to be eaqually as greasy. Ah to each his own. Besides, with Mitchell's dripping off the end it doesn't really matter.
author: Jaymie C.

description:
I go to Burger Joint for the fries but I think the burgers are better elsewhere (Urban Burger, Super Duper).  They're pretty skimpy with the portions on the fries but they're so good I rarely complain.  It's a perfectly fine San Francisco burger (read, slightly overpriced) but I'm surprised they don't sell beer (at least, I didn't see any last time I went). Very limited menu so don't expect a lot of interesting burger varieties.

I also find the space at the Mission location to be really cold and uninviting.

I prefer Urban and Super Duper, but Burger Joint isn't bad if you're really jonesing for a burger and good fries.
author: Courtney N.

description:
Burger Joint came through on a Sunday night when we were in S.F. to see a friend's band play a few doors down at Amnesia.  I was fully expecting to find nothing open at 9pm at night, but sure enough, Burger Joint's "Open" sign was lit.  

Inside, the store was extremely clean - the floors shiny and tabletops sans scraps, crumbs, or other detritus that might make you think twice.  There were only 2 people working - one at the register and another on the grill.  Both were friendly when I asked advice for parking outside, and when I came back to order, service was prompt and with a smile.  Bonus.  

On to the food...  I ordered a "Mini Cheeseburger and Fries," $6.95.  Okay, you might think that's a little pricey for a "Mini" (tack on another $1.50 for a Standard size Chee'burger), but these aren't frozen Costco patties they're serving.  The Niman Ranch beef was tender, flavorful, and cooked-to-order on the plainly visible (from the counter) grill.  The toppings were as fresh as could be - green leaf lettuce (no iceberg here!), dill pickle chips, red onion, fresh tomato, and mayonnaise applied without excess...a definite plus.  The french fries were thick, steak fries and were nice and crispy.  Not too salty, not bland, either.  

Music soundtrack seemed pretty diverse, but the important thing is that the volume was not cranked up to ear-bleeding levels.  All in all, the Burger Joint really hit the spot.  It's good to know there's a place like this that's readily accessible if the late(ish) night craving ever hits when I'm in the City.
author: Aaron J.

description:
Ive seen this place many times when I walk around the neighborhood.  My friend wanted to treat me for lunch and he suggested Burger Joint.  I have never been so I said sure.  We both ordered the Cheeseburger and Fries with a diet coke that came to a total of approx. $23.00.  The food came out pretty quickly which we were both happy about since we were so freakin hungry.

Unfortunately I didn't understand what all the hype was about.  It was on ok burger but nuthing special.  The meat was kinda bland and was not hot when I took my first bite.  I think the prices are a little too steep for what your getting.  Mediocre burgers rather goto Burgermeister on church.
author: Jasen L.

description: The burgers and fries are good but not exceptional and a bit pricey. I might give the food another star or even two but the staff ruined it.
author: Amanda D.

description:
I wouldn't say I was burgin' hard but still had a sizable appetite that a bj veggie burger + fries slew to the tune of 7.95.

They're generous with the toppings--useful since the boca burger on its doesn't make my heart go pitter-patter. But the toppings and bun were fresh and they were generous with the pickle chips, so I would likely come back if craving a burger, or a reasonable substitute thereof.
author: Alan F.

description: I have since had a few good experiences. And, they now have BBQ sauce and dijon mustard. So, I sort of like it.
author: Andrew K.

description: O.K. people!!! Listen up!! I've been coming to the Burger Joint since it opened, and indulge on a big juicy Niman Schell cheddar burger about once a month. I highly recommend getting grilled onions on your burger to add that carmelized goodness to the mix. I think this is the best burger in town! The shakes are pretty amazing as well.
author: April B.

description:
So I was craving a nice burger after a night of drinking and debauchery. I didn't want a fancy burger with brie and truffles and scented oils or whatever other atrocities people think to add. Also, at this point, the boy and I are too hungover to drive, and it's raining, so it had to be close to our place in the mission. Whiz burger (love, love) wasn't open yet so we decided to head down to Valencia and the Burger Joint. I like that they have Niman Ranch beef, and straightforward (i.e., NO TRUFFLES!! FFS) burgers.

The place is cool, I like the retro tables and chairs and posters on the wall. The service was good and friendly. The vanilla milkshake was good. My diet coke was good (?). The fries were ok. The burgers? They were bland. They left me dismayed on this sunday morning. Dismayed. I had to salt my burger, it was so bland. Also, a little skimpy on the beef, and a little too generous on the lettuce. Next time, I'll wait the extra hour or so and stand in line at Whiz.
author: Vicki S.

description:
Ah, Burger Joint, at last we meet.  I knew you were out there somewhere--an SF burger chain whose shtick was not running the gourmet gamut (a la Big Mouth) nor being the village neighbor-hub (a la Bugermeister), but rather, a 50's soda fountain with a minimalist menu and color palette (red, white, cyan and a touch of lemon)--Johnny Rocket's for the local foodies, in other words.

So how'd they do?  Props for the thick-n-fresh fries and equally thick-n-fresh strawberry shake, and they've obviously done their homework on how to craft a juicy turkey patty.  Burger itself is compact and doesn't fall apart (though the aforementioned juice does run everywhere).  Still, I've gotten over the retro thing (or rather, I've gotten so into the retro thing that diners are like playing in the kiddie pool--now steampunk burgers, those would be awesome), so Burgermeister and Big Mouth are more up my alley.  Would have really liked to see how the Saturday night hipster crowd dealt with the vibe (so ironic it's not?  so unironic it is?), but as I was here for Monday lunch, no such luck.
author: Wes M.

description: During the endless driving down packed streets to satiate my craving for Bi-Rite Creamery, I found myself parked right near Burger Joint.  I figure why not eat a burger before ice cream, so as not to disrupt the natural order of entree then dessert.  And why not Burger Joint? Oprah said it is a must have before dying. And we do what Oprah says. So the misses and I decide to give it a shot. Price point is average for a burger, fries and a soda.  Additions, such as bacon, were a tad on the pricey side.  The burger itself was good sized, cooked to order, had the run of the mill grilled taste, and overall a was nothing too spectacular.  Nothing that I would have had to eat before I die though. Shame on you for lying to the public Oprah.
author: Can L.

description:
After first moving to San Francisco, we wanted to find out what the best burger place was in the city, and some review sites pointed us to Burger Joint in the Mission District.  Our expectations were pretty high considering that the restaurant has won some local awards for the best burger in San Francisco, but our experience with Burger Joint hardly competed with your average burger at chain restaurant like a Chili's or TGI Fridays. As you walk in to this very small place, you're immediately confronted with the counter to order your food, so if there are more than a few people waiting to order, they have to stand out the door.   I ordered and the service was friendly, but I wouldn't say that their goal here is memorable customer service, however, the girl brought our food to our table when it was ready.
Now for the bad part...Unfortunately for us and everyone else that was eating there at the time, employees kept going into their "back room" where I would expect that they store cleaning supplies and possibly garbage to be taken out because a very strong odor of rotting garbage would fill the room each time someone opened the door.  Imagine trying to eat while sitting in an open sewer vent.  GROSS!  This made eating our lunch rather unenjoyable considering the dining area is very small and even with the front door open, venting out the nauseating odor wasn't happening.

Overall, if you live within walking distance of this place and are in the mood to spend a little more than you should on an over-rated burger and fries this is the place for you, just make sure you at least get it TO GO unless your into claustrophobia, the smell of decaying garbage or a backed up toilet.
author: Maggie G.

description: Great food, great staff. They took a little longer than expected for food, but they had someone walking around cleaning up. I ordered a Mushroom burger which was cooked perfectly.
author: Jeffrey P.

description: Ok hot dog, fries are the  fat kind ( I prefer skinny) service was good, burger taste fresh but was undercooked.
author: John R.

description: "Someone" told me once that Oprah loves this place, and since Oprah is the closest thing to an actual living god that I know of, I came in expecting a religious experience.  It was just alright.
author: Rachel S.

description: Expensive burgers.  Fine but nothing special.  The cookie cutter 60's diner theme is kind of weird.  When I went on a Saturday night, there was one cook and one cashier/server running the entire place, both of them clearly over worked. The cashier had to keep leaving the line of customers to serve tables.  Also, they had a sign up declaring that they had no public bathrooms available, which pisses me off.  It's hard to spend more than a few hours away from home in this city because absolutely no one will let you use their bathroom.
author: Mark S.

description: I got a delicious philly cheese steak here and have absolutely zero complaints... the fries were extremely good and everything was just, very well prepared. I will most definitely be back soon! Also, we got here late (like 10:30pm on a friday) and it was still a pleasant experience.
author: Terry B.

description: I went to Burger Joint Sunday afternoon after church with my mom. the cashier  was a sweet young chick (i think she was 17 or 18). She was nice and polite. I got a veggie burger that was soo filling and very delicious! aha! One of my fries broke in half and you can tell they use real potatoes. the vanilla shake i drank, had vanilla bean ice cream! soo yum! i really enjoy coming here. good burger, fries and shake! but it was a little pricey for me, (9 bucks a burger, 5 bucks a shake)  xoxox Burger Joint!!
author: Susana R.

description:
Burger Joint serves Niman Ranch meat.  

This is a collective of sustainable family farms and ranches.  This makes me feel better about eating their ground and perfectly-cooked flesh.  (Another thing that makes me feel good about eating it is that it's delicious).  The burgers are cooked to order, either regular or mini-sized, and the fries are not too greasy.

Niman Ranch meat is more expensive, and worth the price.  I don't eat many burgers, but when I do, I'd rather eat the happy cows from the cheese commercials instead of the cows who live miserably in the hot Central Valley (have you seen that place down I-5?  Even the most carniverous human has to feel bad seeing that place.  It's a good reason to take 101 instead and bite the extra hour to LA...not to mention, 101 is a far prettier drive...but I digress).

I think the simple menu is a stroke of genius.  Do one thing, and do it well.  And the service is superb.

Well worth five stars!

www.nimanranch.com

www.burgerjointsf.com
author: Randy F.

description:
This place may not be the bestest burgers in the world (that honor goes to Val's in Hayward), as many here have attested to, but they certainly are the best in the neighborhood.  

We used to go here all the time when I worked across the street, and the burgers are tasty, especially with Jack cheese, the chicken sammies are delish, and they serve humungous portions of fries.  

Also, try the lemonade.  Nothing's better on a scalding hot summer day in the Mission.

Extra points for the uber-nice and accomadating servers.
author: Umilia M.

description:
Ok, I am fearful for the wrath I may got in giving this place less than 4 stars.  

But that's how I feel.

Okay basic burger place.  Small, diner like decor.  Typical diner setting, bunch of tables and a few booths.  They are simple, they offer, burgers, hot dogs and fries.  The burgers offered are the following: cheeseburger, hamburger, chicken burger, veggie burger.  In addition there are hot dogs and french fries.  The cheeseburger comes in a mini size also ( equivalent to a McDonalds Cheeseburger size) which is good if you aren't willing to up your cholesterol too many points in one day.  

The burgers and dogs are made with Niman Ranch meat.  With that knowledge you then expect a higher quality burger and taste.  To be honest, my first bite was delicious, but then the following bites started to get salty for me.  Too salty for my taste.  Despite that though I finished the whole mini cheeseburger, so it wasn't that bad.  Don't let my comments fool you.  The french fries were the thick kind.  Nothing memorable about them.  

Definitely better quality than fast food.................

My boyfriend loves this place.  I have no problem coming here, but I won't be the first to suggest it.

OOOH don't forget it's cash only.
author: Denise B.

description:
Service: 3/5
Food: 3/5
Wait: 4/5
Price: $$
Portions: 3/5
Presentation of food: 3/5
Presentation of restaurant: 3/5
Overall: 3/5

KINDA PRICEY FOR BURGERS THAT AREN'T ALL THAT... I THINK TO BE HONEST, I RATHER HAVE CARL'S JR.
author: Eva H.

description:
I used to work close to this place & it always a good quick bite. 

The burgers are pretty good & i like that they have alternatives to the regular kinds of soda. 

Fries are good & I like that they'll give you mayo too. One of their meals & I'm set from lunch till the next morning. 

One time when I was waiting for my food this group of like 5 people came in & this one guy only wanted a grilled cheese [even though it wasn't on their menu] & they just comped them cause there were so many other people with them. 

Pretty Rad!

Oh & about that same time 2 guys came in expecting a McDonald's type place & left in a huff. It was pretty funny.
author: Rebekah K.

description: Oh yeah, I know this place. This is that burger joint I went to that was incredibly overrated. Typical SF-attitude type of place.
author: Lisa T.

description:
traditional burger, fries 'n' drink....$nine~$eleven....add on a lonely milkshake 'n' pricin' jumppin' a whoppin' $fifteen or more......with only hotdog, chicken breast and vegetarian burger for alternatives...with porky pig's line..."th-th-th-th-th-that's all, folks!"....

checkered grill marks over patty atop bun lookin' excellent...careful placement of pickles, onions 'n' lettuce off to the side....mayo'd bun...thick cut fries..fried to perfection....crisp outer...moist soft inner....wax paper cover'd tin plate sectioned off in four...fries, bun, patty 'n' bun, and veggie fillings....

with fifty cent grilled onions the only topper...leavin' burger meal borin'....*yawn~~~ zz.zz.z.zz.zzz...zzz....*...if searching for traditional standard burger, bj to serve a handsome meal.....yet for thrill seekers of bacon, avacado, egg or more...bj unable to satisfy...while diner neat 'n' clean...for highend burger prices...not satisfactory of effort to come...
author: Hen A.

description:
Possibly one of the best places for a burger in SF. Here's why:

1.) The place is actually quite clean for a place billed as "burger joint" many of the places i have been that have excellent burgers are total dumps, this place is quite clean, and quite comfortable.

2.) The burgers are very large and the portions are very reasonable. Pricey yes, but you get what you pay for in the end. The shakes are bar-none amazing. A few places I have been too have tried to save money by putting chocolate syrup in a vanilla shake. Not burger joint, and that's the mark of quality right there.

The only downside is that they only take cash :-(

This is a big deal for me, especially since, as I already mentioned, they are a bit pricey. For this, they get dinged a star, especially since it isn't that hard to accept credit cards.
author: Adam P.

description:
Way, way, way, way, way, way, way overpriced.  Meal for 2: $30.  That's ridiculous.  Food was okay, certainly not great.  Milkshakes were decent, definitely not transcendent.  Service was polite, not that prompt, not that interested, and not that helpful.

It ain't no Pearl Burger.
author: Ben P.

description:
This review is for the Philly cheese steak. It was pretty bad. Sure, I didn't expect it to be great but I expected it to be good. The meat was over cooked and the whole thing was just really bland and mediocre. It tasted like nothing. Honestly, I enjoyed the salad more than I should've because of that. And even that was a boring lettuce and greens salad with balsamic vinaigrette. 
My sister had the cheeseburger and said it was pretty good, though, so maybe just order the burgers. To add insult to injury, I paid $10.50. Not cool.
author: daria d.

description:
Average. Exceedingly so. Grilled burger meat needs some fat, and Burger Joints meat is lean, which produces a flavorless, less savory patty. It's almost enough to drive me to the Garden Burger, though that's priced at $7, which seems steep for a fake meat patty. You never hear anyone complain about the price of Boca going through the roof. Oh yeah, call it $7.50 if you want cheese on that, although at least you can get american cheese.

For the record, american cheese is for burgers only. And shingling your roof. And maybe Jack In The Box tacos.

So yeah, nothing to see here folks. Just bland, fancy burgers, priced for Whitey. 

Please take the time to visit Big Mouth Burger on 24th & Valencia. Homemade spreads, a selection of tasty buns, delicious burgers and other hand food, amazingly fresh fries. Priced for us workers and the envy of all the eats here at BJs...
author: Jeremy W.

description:
Pretty good! I'm a vegetarian so I had the veggie pattie with fries. The buns were nice and fresh, not too thick that the burger slipped. Fries were hot, crispy and fresh. I like that they had just been cooked and not just sitting under a heat lamp. 

Prices were good, eating environment was decent. 

Overall a good place to stop for a quick bite to eat
author: Holly S.

description:
This Burger Joint is very close to my office and it consistently provides pretty good food.

I had some difficulties making a decision today though.  I kept going back and forth between wanting the mini-cheesburger, which is a much more manageable sized lunch than it's bigger brother, and the chicken burger, which I had never had before.  Smaller portion, but beef is heavier...larger portion, but chicken's healthier...back and forth...back and forth...(not sure if my mind can handle much more indecision!)  

After my 4 colleagues completed their orders ahead of me...I was forced to make my decision.  Chicken burger it is!  It was light and juicy and I'm completely satisfied.  

Alyssa R. knew exactly what she was doing when as she ordered the dawg.  Ah, but there's a twist.  You know how people cut slits into dawgs so that they don't burst?  Well, there was some fancy work going on in the kitchen today because Alyssa R.'s dawg had criss crosses going all up and down her dawg leaving somewhat of a ribbed effect...which yes, was to her pleasure.  

Satisfaction all around!
author: Nicole N.

description:
f there were 6 stars, I would give it.

This is THE STANDARD BY WHICH BURGERS SHOULD BE JUDGED

Beautiful, succulent (almost buttery-melt-in-your-mouth) meat. Ahhh. 

Top quality Niman Ranch. Always cooked to perfection.

I am almost crying writing this review. Why? Is it *that* good? Yes. But now I live in @#*( Alameda and there is no BJ nearby.

PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE BUILD A BURGER JOINT IN THE EAST BAY OH PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE.

Thank you.

PS. The fries are okay, but fuckit, you are here for the burger, no?" 

I am hoping by cross posting this one on the SFO terminal BJ, they may hear my humble plea. How about a BJ at Oakland Airport???
author: Danica B.

description:
Hands down, better burger than Zuni.  Exquisite construction with tasty veggies and quality Niman Ranch meats, gourmet and fast.   Add a slice of cheddar to make it divine.  Simplicity is their secret ingredient and Im smitten.
p.s. love the new mini burger....
author: Jen L.

description:
Niman Ranch meat = less tasty.
In my opinion, the burgers at Big Mouth Burger taste much better.
The fries are good.
Service could be better.
Nice decor, but I don't care that much about it when I eat in a burger place.
author: George M.

description:
After a long day at the Red Bull Soapbox race around the corner, we had another place in mind for dinner but they were closed for a private party, so some wandering around some more led us to our third choice, by way of BJ being near-empty choice.

The owner was nice enough to put some tables together for our semi-large group.

By the time we all ordered, the table was ready.

The burger was good; I ordered the cheese burger, fries, soda. The fries are semi-thick cut (not steak fries). The burger was good, fix'n on the side to create your own in a way. The price of the meal was restaurant price.... 

The menu just has the basics... I don't get how they can charge for the price of their hot dog. You can have like 4 Costco dogs for the price of one of theirs. Quality vs Quantity, whatever, just make me full not rip me off.

There's no parking lot, just street parking.
author: qirk z.

description:
Yes the name is bawdy, luckily this is the only feature shared with Fudruckers.  

Lacking the cheese/topping variety and beer of Bigmouth, but gleaming clean --- making this is the burger place for the OCD. I remember on World Cup day the bathroom here was a sort of pleasant oasis of dappled sunlight and  sweet smelling hand-soap.

The burgers are good, nothing special, but competently made and tasty enough.  The lettuce has always been green and leafy.  There used to be a problem with over-salted burgers, but that seems to have changed for the better.
author: Gustie L.

description:
I love Burger Joint.  Thick cut fries and juicy Neiman Ranch burgers are an indulgence.  Other pluses are it's super clean shiny silver and red vinyl booth atmosphere .  If I'm going to waste calories on super greasy food this is a good choice.

Since it's so close to home I must avert my eyes as I walk past or the magnetic grease force may suck me in.
author: Liz P.

description:
Burger Joint....  

Niman Ranch cheeseburger with cheddar, medium, with grilled onions and fries.  

I grab my dijon mustard, tabasco sauce, ketchup bottle, and a knife to find a table.   Once they call my name for my order I rush up to the counter than back at the table.   I eat my pickles first then squeeze some dijon mustard onto the bottom bun, some ketchup on the top bun, sprinkle of salt on the onions and burger, layer the lettuce and tomato, assemble everything and cut the burger in half.   

Juices from my burger trickle down my hand but the toasted bun holds firm and does not break apart.   Once I finish my first half... I mix some tabasco with ketchup and pepper... and start on my fries before going onto to work on my 2nd half.  

sublime....    When there was the mad cow disease scare... this was the only place I felt okay about ordering a medium rare or rare burger....  yum yum....
author: Regi K.

description:
Well, the BJ joke of this place has been played out.

I sure do like Burger Joint. I always get it mixed up with Burgermeister, but I'm liking this one better now.  They use high-quality ingredients, and you can taste it in the food.  I'm a big fan of the Cheeseburger with cheddar cheese everything on it cooked medium.  The burgers aren't particularly large, but  a good enough size for a decent meal. The fries are good.  That's all I ask from a burger place. 

I haven't tried a shake yet, but word is I won't be disappointed. The lemonade is eh,  nothing special.  

It's a clean facility, but when I went yesterday, a warm day, I wasn't digging the apparent lack of AC at first.  You have to shell out a couple more bucks than the typical "burger joint" (get it, are you LOLing, maybe ROFLing even?), but it's money well spent.
author: Charles R.

description:
This is by far my favorite stop-in place for lunch in the Mission when I'm not in the mood for a burrito. The menu is simple and straight-forward: burgers, dogs, fries, shakes, sodas.  All are made with high-quality natural ingredients and the associated high prices.  The ambiance fits to a tee, with large booths, kitschy colors, and rockin' tunes from 70's soul to 80's rock.  Ask for Abe at the counter and you'll be treated from start to finish.

p.s. free refills too.
author: Jason S.

description:
Great burgers and fries. And a simple menu keeps the line moving (not that there was a line at all when I was there): veggie burger, hamburger, cheeseburger, or mini-cheeseburger.

There are two kinds of "gourmet burger" form factors:

 * Flat and wide. Toppings stay on, and you don't need a jaw hinged like a snake's to eat. However, the sides of your mouth will be messy with ketchup and mustard.
 * Tall and narrow. Toppings maintain their unstable equilibrium atop a mound of beef and bun. Your jaw will need some serious rattlesnake-like action to ingest this tall burger. If you can do that, you will have no muss, no fuss.

Burger Joint's burgers are of the former flat-and-wide style, just like I like them.
author: Rob T.

description:
The burgers are really quite tasty, and the fries are thick cut and delicious.  Service is always quick and friendly.

I would give this joint 5 stars except for the lack of burger toppings.  They have all the basic topping covered (cheese, lettuce, tomato, onions, pickels, mayo, ketchup), and they are always fresh and tasty.  But why such a limited selection? 

I mean, maybe (MAYBE!) I can understand not having mushrooms and bacon as they take some amount of prep (although they will grill up what seems like an entire onion for a buck).  But no avacado?  Is this not California?  Isn't there some regulation that every sandwich place must offer over priced avacado as an option? Common BJ.  We want avacado!!
author: Lenza M.

description:
I experienced perfect french fries here, of the thicker, perfectly-crispy-outside-and-soft-inside variety.  And there was real vanilla in the vanilla milkshake.  The burger was HUGE.  It was pretty good, but because I don't eat much meat these days I felt like it took DAAYZ to digest (tmi, I know).  

Comfortable booth seating and surprisingly nice folks working there considering all the rude hipsters they have to deal with on a given Friday evening.
author: Chalk A.

description:
Meh.

Grabbed a burger here while out pub-crawling, and was very disappointed. Burger was smashed into the grill until it lost all semblance of juiciness and the fries were foodservice crap. Too pre-fab, too overcooked, too... generic. There was no line, and it still took almost 15 minutes to get our food. Food this mediocre shouldn't take that long.
author: anita c.

description:
The hot dog comes "ribbed for your pleasure," according to the Boss Lady.

The fries are hot, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. 

The Diet Coke is a Diet Coke.

Everything was gone in 10 minutes.

The subsequent indigestion and nausea are added bonuses.
author: Alyssa R.

description:
People always argue which is the best burger in S.F.  Burgermeister? Bills?  Well, for those of you who weren't around to experience Hot N Hunky, this kinda picks up where they left off...sans the gay menu.  Hot N Hunky was my favorite burger place and BJ burgers are very reminiscent of it.   

Hehe... 

Damn those fries RULE!!!!
author: Larry A.

description:
They don't have bacon??? They don't have ranch sauce???? How the fuck do I eat a bacon cheeseburger? What do i dip my fries in?

And a chain-y decor? Hell to the no.

AND the guy that took my order didn't say one damn word to me. Just nods and grunts. Come on buddy, would it kill you?

However, the burgers (despite the lack of bacon) and the fries make my tastebuds dance and sing. Fries are crispy on the outside, hot and soft on the inside. Just how a fry should be. Bless them for that.
author: emily w.

description:
Walking back from the Red Bull Soapbox Derby my stomach was growling to the point where it would growl no more, it gave up the growling and subsided into desperation and somber despair. iPhone search had failed as well as trying to call a friend to suggest places for us. We passed a bunch of fully packed restaurants but didn't want to wait.

Then a ray of light glistening magically in the reflection of the window, blind me for a second to pause in front of Burger Joint. And it was like something other worldly was calling out to us that we should eat here. Ok no, not really that's not what happened at all, but isn't it nice to imagine things like that happen in real life?

Basically one Henry L. was like hey, this place is open and not too full. Let's go there. So we went and the place was pretty full. They don't have a ton of tables, but through the tried and true divide and conquer technique, I scoped out tables while Henry L. and crew ordered food. By they time they were done ordering in the long time, I had already acquired a table. 

The burger was decent, the fries were bleh. I didn't even finish them because they weren't crispy on the outside like I like them. I was hungry, but the burger was enough to quench the mad hunger pains that my stomach was assaulting upon itself. 

Trying to look up this place to review I find out that it's a chain. *sigh* I was hoping it was just a mom and pops joint where they are working out some stuff, but as a chain, it wasn't all that good.
author: Jessica C.

description: This is a very good burger spot in the Mission.  I went here to hang while my bike was getting worked on at Mission Cyclery and was pleased with all aspects of my time here.  The service was fast, booths were clean and the burger was very good.  After a long day of drinking at Dolores this was exactly what I needed to allow me to power through the night.
author: Bryan M.

description:
Holy Krikey, I can't believe I haven't reviewed BJ until now. I was just there recently - got take-out cuz I was working across the street at City Art - the choco shake was so thick I had to wait for it to melt a bit before I could even drink it - fries were chunky and made with the skins - I didn't get enough ketchup to put on my burger but it was so flavorful (and nicely rare) that I'm glad.
Years ago they had bj shirts and hats on the wall and I tried to buy one (bj - get it) but was told they didn't sell them anymore - I was seriously considering getting a job there for a day just for the hat.
author: Colin S.

description: Philly Cheese Steak Duuuude!!!! I want beef, salty, cheezy, beef on a french roll.  Why do they make this so good.  Now this place is probably better known for their burgers, but I can't say if they're any good, because I never order them.  I don't even consider ordering them... Why?  Because I love their Philly Cheese Steak!  Enough said.
author: Luciano A.

description: A throwback to 50's diners, this place oozes style. Luckily, this style translates well into their burgers. They are as delicious as they come, as well as properly sized. The fries are stellar as well. If you want to travel back to another time, this place is a good stop!
author: Haz O.

description: A little pricey for burgers. They are good, but a burger for $9? Not so sure. It's a good once in awhile thing, me thinks. Fattening deliciousness that probably cost more than it should.
author: Jeff R.

description: Delicious burgers, fresh ingredients, fast, and simple food.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Damn good cheeseburger, great shakes, thick cut french fries, simply done well
author: Vanessa H.

description:
I was in a hurry to grab food before 'work' about a week ago, and stopped by here to pick up something. Interesting kitschy interior: miscellaneous stencils on the wall, menu made of see-through neon plastic, etc. The layout was pretty awkward, huge empty space down the middle leading to the counter, with small tables on either side. I duno, to me it felt really divided and empty. 

Anyway, just a burger & fries for me, a cheeseburger & fries for my lady, and a root beer. I waited a good while before my food was ready, but this wasn't so bad and understandable for a freshly cooked burger. The whole burger itself was pretty fresh, the veggies, sauce, bread, & meat. I enjoyed it, and it made me full, but I wasn't super impressed or anything. It wasn't the best damn burger ever, but definitely worthy for an occasional rushed meal.
author: Trish A.

description:
The Niman Ranch beef is great, but the bun is just a basic large hamburger bun which is very disappointing. You also get stuck with fries with everything.
Read my full review at: http://sibilous.blogspot.com/2005/07/burger-joint.html
author: Don H.

description:
Look ma, no feces!

After being thoroughly brainwashed by the constant barrage of disparaging press brought upon fast food restaurants (founded or not, the power of negative suggestion rules all, unfortunately), I've decided to patronize neighborhood joints for my burger fixins in the hope that I may enjoy a meal without fear of intestinal parasites. 

The unimaginatively named Burger Joint suggests equally unimaginative fare, and for the most part their burgers are exactly that. You get the usual fixings on your burger--lettuce, tomato, pickles, onions, and mayo, and a slice of cheese if want it--and a small bag of fries to go along with it. The difference is that the quality of the burger and fries are so much better than your usual fast food place. Each burger is made to order so you may have to wait a few minutes before you get your meal, but that beats eating assembly line food any day in my book.

On the negative side, a full meal will run you about 10 bucks so it's not quite competitive with the prices you'll get at average quickie food places. Also, the service is somewhat hit-or-miss. The attitude of the employees towards store patrons is "So whatchu want?" more than "Can I help you?"; not necessarily rude, but somewhat apathetic. The burgers are supposed to be front-and-center at BJ, so if all you really care about is your meal, then how helpful they are shouldn't matter at all.

I wouldn't necessarily call Burger Joint's burgers fantastic enough to warrant a cross-town trek, but if you're in the neighborhood it's certainly worth the few additional bucks to get a meal here than at any of the McDonald's or Burger King branches on Mission.
author: Raffy E.

description: The menu's not extensive, but if I need a beef burger and fries, this is the place to go to.  I'm on a budget so I'm not going to go to the Marina or Pacific Heights for a fancy schmancy hormone-free burger, but I can feast instead on an authentic Niman Ranch burger for less here. This isn't the cheapest burger place, but locally raised, chemically-free, yet reasonably-priced meat is what I prefer.
author: Bodhi D.

description: Had a turkey burger and it was burned, fries were undercooked and tasteless, and so called malt didn't have malt in it. All that for almost $17...awful. Never going back.
author: M B.

description:
I can always use a bj.  The ambiance has a weirdly sterile 1990's-trying-to-be-1950's feel, with faux neon and those strange/creepy wall stencils, but DANG are they good burgers.  They use Niman Ranch beef, as has been oft mentioned, which makes you feel like less of a heathen for chomping away on dead cow.  Like somehow the deaths of Niman Ranch cows (who are apparently accompanied by their ranchers to the slaughterhouse and only killed once they are "calm")  incur less of a karmic debt for my palate and colon.  Not sure if the Dalai Llama would agree...

But the fries, ooh I love me their steak fries.  No question His Holiness  would totally nom some of these bad boys.  Only once were they not perfect (a little undercooked), and if I was able to keep track of how often I go there, I'd let you know what percentage that was--somewhere in the 2-3% range, at most.

I also love that the burger is big, but in a "flat and wide and plenty of bites" way and not in an "unhinge your jaw to get your mouth around it" way, which can be annoying.  For burgers.
author: Kevin H.

description: Totally awesome burger, mediocre fries, or I would have given them 4*s.  They also need a bar or something here, maybe that would help them pick up some business.  Oh yeah, and turn down the florescent lighting, geez!
author: e w.

description: I've been going to this place for many years - fresh burger. Not too many stuff in the menu.  It's simple burger, not the best I had, but best in mission.   Their price is kind of expensive, for a burger and soda will cost you close to $10. Wow....
author: ji k.

description:
The burgers are good, but like everyone else has been saying, I think that they are a little too over-priced. It is quality meat (it says so on their menu, blah, I kinda hate when resteraunts do that) and they taste good, but nothing to write home about.

I love hamburgers, they are my favorite thing to eat... I don't think I've ever even had a bad one (I'll even eat McDonald's hamburger! ahh...!), but if I am going to pay $9 for a burger and fries, it better at least taste better than, say, a Nation's burger (which I love and the price is right... are there any of those in the City?). Lastly, the fries are a little boring, and waaaay too greasy (they taste like they are way MSG'd out).

Overall, I will probably eat there again, if the office pays for it, but I don't think I am going to go out of my way to get one of their burgers.

Oh, their chicken burger is really good too, but again, overpriced... and their shakes kinda suck. I think they flavor them! Noooooooo......
author: evan Y.

description:
Exactly what the name suggests, and they do a simple thing very well.

My burger was large and thin, really juicy, and pleasantly medium rare with just a hint of pink in the middle.  Fries were tasty with no hint of salt.  Quite clean surroundings, and they have a Zagat notice of excellency up front with an amusing blurb.

But with a meal clocking in at over $21 for two with sodas, there are cheaper places to get your fix when you don't want to cook at home and don't want mexican (Deja Vu pizza, etc).
author: Elliott W.

description:
This is my first review, my first burger in San Francisco, and hell, my first solo restaurant experience in San Francisco -- I just moved here from London. (And we all know how well-known England is for quality cuisine, right? Right?)

The key thing here is the meat in the burger: it's more like a steak-in-a-bun, really high quality and delicious. The rest of the stuff is fresh and works well. The thick-ass fries are not the way forward: fries are all about maximizing the fried-to-potato ratio, and there is way too much potato here.
