The prices aren't bad for the quality of the meat -- it's expensive for a burger, but really good value for a steak.

The place is gleamingly clean and the service is fast, but both of those things may have to do with the way the place is totally empty.

3 stars for great food quality. The final 2 are lost for having no ambience to speak of and the thick fries, but hey, some people like thick fries (crazy people).
author: Laurie V.

description:
Good fries, better burgers!
kinda pricey for a burger joint though.
the girl behind the counter was really nice and helpful.
author: Matt V.

description:
Of all the places I've had burgers, this place has the perfect looking burger I've eaten. The shape of the medium rare beef patty and the perfectly cut onions, lettuce and pickles fit the sesame seed bun like a glove. It didn't even break apart or slop all over the tray as I was eating it. That being said the taste of the burger matched the presentation. Medium rare and juicy, not that much ketchup was needed which was a plus. The steak fries they served were nothing special but decent. 

A pretty decent lunch spot for those sunny summer Saturday afternoons.
author: Jordan A.

description:
i'm knocking off two whole stars for cash only,ya thats right,keeping it real.Cash only annoys me to no end .

Onto the food,i had a cheeseburger.It was alright.nothing special,nothing horrible.just OK.the fries aren't superb but I will admit i'm not a big fries fan
author: Lauren V.

description: I'm not really sure what the hype is all about for this place. I ate there once and it was enough. The retro, super cheesy decor doesn't help the mediocre food either. It was a decent burger and fries, but you're better off just hitting In-n-Out.
author: Ben E.

description: The name says it all. If you're looking for a straight up burger joint--and maybe some nostalgic decor--look no further. There burgers and fries are solid and made to order. The menu is limited though, so make sure no one in your party is feeling adventuresome. Prices are potentially a bit high for what you get, but there is a mid-afternoon happy hour where everything is 1/2 price. So if you're craving food mid-day (potentially 2-5? not sure), then this place is a great deal.
author: Drew U.

description:
Surprised that are several are not fans of their burgers...Discovered the burgers by accident while at SFO-International Terminal where they have a location...Incredible!...Overjoyed that they also had two locations in the city (Lower Haight and Mission).

Could be a little cheaper and they could be a little faster with preparing things (I typically call ahead and order on my way, BurgerJoing occupies a slot in my mobile) but I love the fries and the Niman Ranch burger is verrrry tasty....Might also suggest a little better bun.

It's definitely among the best burgers I've had in SF and love going back
author: Barca F.

description:
I love Burger Joint!  I can't seem to remember the first time I went there, or how I found out about it (my first visit must have been at least 4 years ago?)  They only serve Neiman Ranch beef, which instantly makes the burgers some of the best in the city.

You may be asking yourself, "If he likes this place so much, why only 4 stars?"  Well, they don't accept VISA/Mastercard!  I can go to the post office and buy a .39 cent stamp with my VISA debit card, but can't charge the $20 to have dinner with my girlfriend!  Its acceptable when a small business sets a minimum for cards, but to not accept it at all is ridiculous.

They don't even have an ATM - so in order to get raped by a "service charge" you need to head across the street to the corner store. 

(If Burger Joint changes their policy on credit/debit card transactions, I'll give 'em the 5th star - It's not much leverage, but its all I have..)
author: Anthony B.

description:
It is a little bit pricey but the food is always hot and I appreciate their quality of meat & free Range chicken. 

It is a good burger, not great but pretty good. The chicken sandwich is a nice option when you are feeling like trying to make a healthy choice. it comes on a wheat bun which is a nice touch but you have to ask for cheese and grilled onions on it which lends the sandwich its only flavor.

If the Phoenix is open, I say hop next door for a Patty Melt and taytoes!
author: Ashley T.

description:
I DONT WANT NO MOTHER F**KING FRENCH FRIES.

other than that, the burgers are pretty good, not stellar, but good if you're close and want a burger.
author: christopher a.

description: Shitty service at the SFO location means I'd advoid it.
author: Damon S.

description: Decent place to dine if you are craving for burgers.. I ordered a hamburger on wheat, add sauteed onions.. very juicy, I must say.  I will try their turkey burger next time and their chocolate milkshake.
author: Tram N.

description: If you're going to charge me 15 dollars for a burger and a milkshake, it better be damn good.  Sadly, Burger Joint failed.  I asked for it medium, which didn't matter, because it was quite well-done, even dry and flaky in pieces.  The fries were nothing special.  In the end, this place isn't as good as In-N-Out at double the cost.  What more can I say?
author: David L.

description:
When else do you get to say that you had a BJ for lunch?

San Francisco has been disappointing to me on the burger front, and BJ is no different. It's pretty good. Will do in a pinch if you're craving a burger, but it won't make you cream your shorts, and really, what kind of a BJ is that?

A solid but middling 3-star spot.
author: David K.

description: I had been craving a burger and sweet potato fries for a while and happened to be near here and decided to give it a try. I agree with some other reviewers that the burger was bland - though it was salty - not a good combination. The sweet potato fries were really boring and some were burnt. The chocolate shake was good, but all together this was an insanely overpriced, blah meal.
author: T _.

description:
Decor was disturbing. 50s diner meets modern hipster... .not in a good way. 

Soundtrack sucked. 50s country I think....

Food was fairly mediocre. The burger was big, but the whole thing was bland. 

Nothing to write home about.
author: A K.

description:
Im a burger -a- holic, ok? and this place is my secon-scratch that- third fave in SF... This is the order of awesomeness:
1. tuesday burger day at Rosamunde Sausage Grill and Toronado beer!
2. Zeitgeist burger + beer
3. Burger Joint burger
4. Metro Cafe
5. Tower Burger
6.Big Mouth Burger
author: Benjamin H.

description:
Decent burgers, decent fries, good shakes all in a spacious interior.  Good for a burger fix, but as other have said, no gourmet options here.

Cash only is a slight annoyance, and there is no ATM in the restaurant - you have to go across the street to the liquor store.
author: GeneR S.

description: Cheesesteak was just OK.  Fries were really good.  Prices were a bit high for a cheap burger joint.
author: Kyle B.

description: The burgers are good, the fries are bangin', the shakes even more so... They play good music and offer friendly service. Conveniently cash-only, i.e., there is an ATM literally right outside the door just in case. It is a little pricey for what it is (a cheeseburger w/ fries, burger w/ fries & a milkshake came out to nearly $24 - yikes), but it was all pretty scrumptious!
author: Rebecca F.

description: Not bad.  Not the best burger I've ever had, but nothing to complain about.  My cheeseburger patty was nicely cooked (medium rare, just as I requested), all the ingredients tasted nice and fresh, the service was good, and the prices seemed reasonable.  Not as good as Big Mouth, but still, not too shabby.
author: Angela B.

description: I've seen this place listed as "best burger in San Francisco" or as a "Top cheap eats" and I gotta say, I don't get it.  I mean, it was tasty, but it wasn't any better than In N' Out--which, consequently, is even cheaper.  B. Joint has a simple menu, tasty milkshakes.  Curiously, every time I pass one, it's totally empty, which isn't the best sign.  If you pass one and you're starving, go for it, but I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.
author: Kristin P.

description: Like a fancier In 'N' Out without the secret ordering tricks (unless I just don't know them) and hidden Bible references. The bare-bones menu (burgers, fries, shakes) is a little pricier than your standard diner fare, but they use good-quality meat. If you usually get your steak medium, get your burger medium-well, a pinkish center oval. Just what was needed to cure my taco/burrito fatigue. All they need is a cocktail table Mrs. Pacman.
author: Katrina D.

description:
it completely baffles me that burger joint proudly displays the big 'b j' sign on the window. mr. burger joint, when the perverted people of san francisco (that's me!) think of 'b j', i can assure you that burger joint is not the first thing that comes to their minds. hehe, as matter of fact, i believe there is a 'happy ending' talk thread that is now circulating in the yelp land. good gawd! what a perverted online community.

ok, the burgers and fries are decent, but it's certainly not as pleasurable or orgasmic as the real 'b j.' hence i prefer to walk five blocks to 24th/valencia and grab me a big mouth burger.
author: frisco j.

description: Overpriced burgers and fries.  I know it's quality meat and the food is fairly good, but in the end, it's just a burger.  Nothing more.
author: Honey L.

description: So many bad reviews? People really get their panties in a bunch over burgers don't they? I don't want to freak anyone out, but I think Burger Joint makes a really good hamburger. Quality beef properly salt & peppered, cooked to order, excellent meat to bun ratio, cheese choices, grilled onions, dijon if you ask, thick cut fries, mmmilkshakes. Also on the menu, veggie, chicken & hot dog options. No problems here. I could cry over that cute little mini burger too! How nice to be able to order a me-sized meal and not feel like some kid in Africa starved cause I couldn't finish what was on my plate. Hear that Mom?
author: J. R.

description: Sure it's a bit spendy lately, but BJ still has a warm place in my heart. The ultimate in the basic burger is matched closely by some tasty thick-cut fries and an equally thick and tasty shake. I can't really say it's the best burger in the city, because there are a lot of awesome unique burgers out there, but it's not very long before I have to head back for more.
author: Chris R.

description: Meh.  I have had better.  But it wasn't horrible and good for those days when I want a burger and don't feel like going to In -n- Out.
author: Dottie G.

description: My wife and I were underwhelmed by the plain fare here.  I'd skip this place and head down to Big Mouth near 24th & Mission.
author: Joe H.

description: By far, consistantly the best burger I have ever had.  Ive been going there at two or three times a month for over 7 years.  I am a major carnivore, and the meat is always fresh and cooked perfectly.  the buns are always fresh and the fries never taste as though the grease is old.  The vanilla malts rock!  I think they are one of the best deals in town for the quality.
author: Jay B.

description: solid place for a decent burger. the fries are of the steak fry variety, which i don't necessarily prefer (though i ate them all).
author: Ameer N.

description: Burger Joint makes a kick-ass burger, no doubt about it. Juicy, cooked just the way I like it (medium rare), not too huge but substantial enough. Accompanied by thick, crispy fries that are fresh and warm, not soggy and cold. I don't think this place is too expensive; for what you get, the price is right. Serviceable servce (not super-warm, but it doesn't need to be). The interior is clean, bright, and a little stark, but that's so much better than grunge -- see Barney's, Burgermeister. Works for me and my hamburger jones. I too giggle at the "bj" signage, but really.
author: Tara M.

description: An old favorite lunch spot.  Great burger and big steak fries.  If you're not that hungry or don't have a big appetite to begin with, go with the mini burger and fries - that will be enough.
author: Julie M.

description:
I don't know why i keep giving these people my money. Usually the burgers are pretty good. Used to go once  a week, or once every couple of weeks, but have been having bad experiences, swear not to go anymore, and then i crave a good burger and give them another chance.

Today was the last time. (probably) I called in and got a  burger to go, asked them to wrap the meat separately, (so the bread is completely soaked through with grease by the time i get home). 


The girl that works there is always very nice and the quality of the food always seemed to match...

These boys have dissapointed me many times, and the guy was soo rude today. (didn't say a word, i asked for extra ketchup and mayo, which he threw at me, as well as throwing the change into my hand and did not even say anything as half of  it fell onto the counter. ) 

It seemed like an extra busy day today, there was a lot of people in there, maybe they were pissed about that. they might actually make some tips if they were slightly less than incredibly rude....i don't know, maybe i'm the only one that's picky about that kind of thing. 

In the past when the same people were working, i got home to discover and incredibly greasy yet incredibly over cooked burger that  i didn't even eat, another time the crispy fries i asked for were almost not cooked at all and totally spongey...where's the girl??

where is she? what happened. 

i was at the counter today debating how much to tip after the guys signaled that the transaction was over by gesturing to the person behind me..( no "thankyou" or anything frivolous) like that) and decided on thirty five cents as opposed to the 2 dollars or so that i would normally give...when i got  home i whished that i didn't even give them that because they did not wrap my meat separate, which i wold like to think is an oversight, but i just don't think so . 

i guess the owner doesn't know or care that the people are getting treated like this, i'm sure business is good and they are not worried about losing any.
author: allison W.

description: I don't know guys. I eat my share of burgers and this is one of my favorite places to grab one. The service? You order at the counter, they bring you your food. The price? This ain't McDonald's. You're going to get a restaurant quality burger. You could go to Denny's, pay more, and have a much worse burger. I like In-N-Out and Nations. Maybe you can argue they have better value, but there is NO WAY you can tell me that their burgers/fries/shakes taste better. Take it from somebody that goes to all of these places a lot. Burgers are about the MEAT. Only complaint I have is parking during busy hours. Oh, and I reccomend the strawberry milkshake. Yum!
author: Bill K.

description:
Read an article from a GQ Magazine "20 Burgers you must try before you die"... 
Thought I would start down the list with my hometown, SF. So, the retro jetson decor was very cute. The menu simple. Took my first bite, second, third...I really tried to see how this burger got on this list...considering the writer had mentioned that  he travelled around the US trying 100s of "hamburgers".  Nothing special.  I have had better, juicer, and tastier burgers at simpler places. Oh, not to mention... overpriced.
author: Jade B.

description: I'm not even kidding, their fries smelled like the fair. They were hot and delicious and skin-on and a small order was the size of a medium pizza. And they were friendly as all hell.
author: Shannon V.

description: hi. are you a hipster? no? are you sure? why else would you be contemplating coming to this place? look at the sign. and the prices. the burger was OK. the fries were the thick and uncrunchy variety. the cost for both of them together was stupid.
author: Will R.

description: I'll give them 1-star because I have to rate them somehow but WOW, this place is pretty bad! And that's bad meaning bad not bad meaning good! The burger I had was not only dry as all heck but it was also burned to a crisp. The fries didn't help much either. Tasteless is all I can say. Basically if you have no taste buds whatsoever this eatery is a dream... Otherwise, I advise you to stay away at all costs. Totally not worth the time or money to come here if you want a good burger fix! Try Big Mouth Burger on 24th near Valencia. You'll thank me for it - TRUST!
author: Yolee R.

description: Medium. The food is just a bit formulaic.  Not what a burger joint should be.
author: patrick g.

description:
So I was here last night after nearly strangling my old manager while helping her run errands for her wedding to her gf in December, when she starts bitching at me about how she NEEDS french fries, as the gf has banned her from them so that she will have lost some weight and fit into her tux (she is the butch half of the pair). So I start rattling off places that serve french fries, and I decide (since she has become inept at making them - decisions, i mean) to go over to Valencia, and see what kind of luck she has with the parking gods. I was RIDICULOUSLY lucky, and found a space one spot away. Ex-manager had never been here, and she ordered a veggie burger, and i got a hot dog, both with sides of fries. I also offered (because I like to start trouble with my lactose intolerant friend) to split a chocolate shake, which was bad for me because I'm congested, but good for me because I'm PMSing. We order, and grab a table. This place is clean, and after going to wash my hands and do some business, the bathroom is also clean, and also well ventilated. I like that. 
We get our food, and it is all good. I missed having hot dogs, and their neiman ranch ones are fabulous. They also grilled onions for me, and that made it even better. I don't eat veggie burgers (something about them being against my religion, i think) but ex-manager said they were very good.
I'm not a HUGE fan of their fries, I can't quite put my finger on why, but yea. Their shakes are beyond awesome. Yes, they are five dollars, but they are the best ice-cream oriented five dollars you can spend on Valencia. 
It is a bit pricey for shakes and fries and burgers since they don't give real table service, but every once in a while, it's definitely worth a visit.
author: Jessica S.

description:
the name couldn't describe the place any better: it's a diner pretty much that makes burgers and shakes. the burgers are awesome, and the shakes are pretty damn good. 

the best part about coming here was the fact we were going out to get dinner with our friend from boston before he got on a plane, and he happens to be a vegetarian. so of course out of all the places in the entire city we could go, we take him to the burger joint. 

but they have veggieburgers, so your vegetarian friend (or girlfriend is probably more likely) can't say that burger joint isn't for them. get them a big ass milkshake and they'll shut up.
author: David D.

description: Thank you Yelp! Burger Joint is a few blocks from my office and when I was in need of a burger and fries I would walk up. But I totally forgot about Big Mouth Burgers until I read the Yelp reviews. The Burger Joint is absolutely adequate, but I really like Big Mouth's food so after having lunch at Big Mouth today, it is my new default burger spot.
author: Seamus M.

description: Good service and the food is made when ordered. The bathrooms are clean and its located within reach of the Valencia/Mission Districts aka in my book, Hipsterville.  I'd give it 4-5 stars, yet the fries are fried in peanut oil and I'm allergic to nuts.  They also charge all the drinks separately.
author: R C.

description: Excellent food, clean and simple with a short menu, open 11am to 11pm what more could you ask for? Niman Ranch hot Dogs, is that an oxy moron? Boo cash only.
author: Missy I.

description: I thought they would have more than just burger, cheese burger, hot dog and veggie burger. Not a lot of selection, nor any extra items to add onto your burger (no avocado!!!). But the veggie burger and fries were satisfactory.
author: Alyssa C.

description: I definitely enjoy the Niman Ranch beef at all Burger Joints.  The main variability factor seems to be how the burgers are cooked.   I like medium rare but often it's over cooked.  When it's overcooked, the meat here loses a lot of it's flavor for me.  If it was $1 cheaper they'd get five stars.
author: Gene X.

description: Okay I'm now a believer in the Turkey Burger although I love the burgers at this location it's lean and fat-free even though over this week I been eating burger and grease I'm a junk food junkie.
author: Accord T.

description: I am not into burgers.  I would rather go for a fast food burger than a fancy burger with blue cheese or carmelized onions or...well, you get the idea.  That's why I totally love Burger Joint.  They keep it simple.  It's good.  Amazing french fries, too.
author: T-Bone L.

description:
the burger was decent... nothing special about it.  there's not a whole lot of variety on the menu... pretty limited.  i think they have hot dogs too, but that's pretty much it.
the staff looked pretty bored.
i'd chose in n out any day over this bj...
author: charlotte s.

description:
All I have to say is NOM NOM NOM. I love, BJ's burgers. The atmosphere is, well.. eh. You know. Self-reflexive pseudo 50s fare, but I forgive them, cause the food is good. The people are always nice. And the best thing about this place... hands down, is that they keep out bottles of malt vinegar for the fries.

Finally, an American eatery who understands that.
author: Jonny P.

description: Good place to grab a burger and fries in the Mission.  Colorful restaurant with a very simple menu selection.  But don't get me wrong, I love smaller menus...it allows the cooks to focus in on making particular dishes great, instead of making a trillion things ok. I skipped the coke (those things will kill you!) and ordered a cheeseburger with fries.  My meal came out very hot and very quickly and  the fries were thickly cut and pretty good.  The burger was tasty (although my meat was a bit too pink for my liking) and the ingredients were fresh.  $7.50 for a burger and fries (without the coke) IS on the pricey side, especially for a place that calls itself a "joint" but I enjoyed my meal and would go back.
author: LaSha G.

description: Good Burger.  Fries slightly well done the way they should be.  The lemonade was way tart, and I'm not sure if that's good or bad.   About 20% overpriced, I'd say.
author: Big Stu L.

description: Best burger I've had in a really long time, maybe ever!  They use sustainable ingredients, too.  Plus there's a veggie burger for my vegetarian other half.  I'm not sure why this place gets such mixed reviews.  Maybe I just don't get out much!
author: Rachael K.

description:
ahhh nostalgia...  my dad's business used to be not too far from here before he relocated... my early teen saturdays consisted of working @ his shop, but lunch for the staff was always on him -- our pick!  this is how i learned about great food in the city @ such a young age... and some eateries still remain after all these years...  after all the changes and stuff the mission has gone through..  *sigh*

anyhow.. back to burger joint..  they have always served free range meat and chix burgers!  the veggie burger was always there..  and that's a lot to say for the early '90s since the health craze wasn't that prominent...  i've always loved their food, and back then i was an omnivore.  here is where i had my first taste of a veggie burger, and i loved it...  this shoulda been the first indications or foreshadow to my choice of eating now: herbivorism.

fast forward..  a new decade, a new century @ that...  burger joint is still here, and still as great as ever... everyone i have taken here has absolutely loved it...  i still love it.  they have even expanded w/their lower haight st. addition.  

their menu is simple... not too many items, but all good.  ask for grilled onions, if u like that sorta thing.

mmmmmmmmmmmmmmm!

last time i ate here my gf pointed out the bj acronym...  why is it i've been eating here for more than half my life and i didn't notice this?  apparently other people have as well.. hah!
author: Sheri N.

description: Very very good burger. Nice looking on the inside too.  I love the shiny chrome and red vinyl booths.  Kinda reminds me of a George Jetson 50's Diner.
author: Kathryn F.

description: Great, fresh giant sized burgers and house cut fries- yum. This is one of the best burgers in SF.  Too bad the place was dead (for them) but for us it made a short wait and a nice quiet lunch, we'll be back next time we are hankering for ground beef- this place blows Barney's on 24th Street away- even thought they have great toppings the meat at Burger Joint is far superior.
author: James S.

description:
Food is decent, but it's way too expensive. Cash only doesn't help. $30+ for 2? This burger better get me high or something.

Try it once, I suppose, but I suggest going elsewhere.
author: Alexis C.

description: Tasty burgers, high quality Niman Ranch meat, and a casual atmosphere. I think this place is better than the more popular Burgermesiter.  A little pricey, but hey, we live in San Francisco!
author: Kimberly G.

description: BJ's burgers are the best! Juicy meat simply served with/without 4 choices of cheese. Fries are thick cut and crispy. Everything cooked to order and served on silver platters. Retro diner style. Good value at $8 for a platter.
author: marsdenbel

description: First I like to say I don't eat beef burger in a restaurants but my 2 American friends wanted to have burger, it is their food habits, so we went there, it was a  burger with those condiment ketchup mustard relish and not to forget the great coke with about 23 tea spoon sugar for 12 FL oz as the nutritionists say, and you wonder why we are overweight?  You've got to love it. Anyway I enjoyed  the company and the place was clean and the staff was friendly.
author: sweetie p.

description: This place is not bad.  Its your average burger but just a little bit tastier, I wouldn't say its that cheap.   Overall I would say its just okay.
author: Tony C.

description: Just the place for a burger.  While they don't have Bacon and the prices are a wee bit expensive, the fries are perfect and Nimian ranch beef burgers are served exclusively.  Unless you want a veggie burger which hasn't disappointed me yet. Also on the menu are Mitchels ice cream shakes.
author: Ian H.

description: pretty good, should be better. Actually, I think it used to be, ages ago, but that's all a distant burger memory now.
author: Jeremy H.

description: Not the best burger in town, but it's among the city's top 5. I like the simplicity but I don't like the cost. Still, it's fun to say, "Let's go get BJ's for lunch."
author: Tal K.

description: Give it a try, it's pretty good.  The burgers are bigger than most fast-food places, and much fresher.  It costs a bit more than those places, but if you're in the mood for a good burger, go here.
author: Matt P.

description: No freakin clue what these other people are talking about. That shit was dry as Death Valley. Some lame-ass patty. You can't freakin do a freakin machine made flat ass patty medium you novices. Reminds me of Micky D's. If you never had a good burger, don't freakin come on yelp talkin about this shit is good. I'm yet to find a real fat juicy handmade burger in SF. Would someone please help me out. So far, I'm ok with Big Mouth. BJ's can't touch Big Mouth with a ten foot pole!
author: Jay N.

description: Last time I came here I ordered a burger well done and it was bloody. I went back to have it recooked and the same result.
author: Jay E.

description: The burgers are good but nothing spectacular. The fries are good too but nothing I would seek out. I know this sounds crazy, but the shake was a little too thick and a little too chocolaty.  Not a lot of options or variety, I guess I was spoiled by big mouth. Oh, and no beer and cash only.
author: Jen S.

description:
Really, really great burgers and fries. Decent but not stellar milkshakes, but the food is the draw here - really crisp, tasty fries and large burgers that are, well, dripping with grease but in a good way. Yes, you kind of feel like you're eating about a pound of pure fat between the fries and the burger but at least you'll remember the great burger when you're grossly fat & dying on your toilet a la Elvis. Comfortable booths and decent music and it's usually not noisy in there.

They're cash only, which is very annoying, and the prices are quite high given that there is no table service and the dining is pretty much fast-food style, but did I mention that the burgers & fries are really great?
author: Jacob D.

description:
Best Burgers in town.
Best service in town.
Best location in town.

I'm talking seriously good burger fries and a coke kinda place.

I'm going there now cause I just talked myself into it with this review.
author: fadedz m.

description: I dont always want avocado or bacon, but I like the option to be there (see my review of Burgermeister)  The burgers are just ok, I am not a fan of thicker cut fries in general, but they do have a smaller burger option which is sorta nice
author: b s.

description: I love the burgers here and the fries seem to be thicker than what I remember from my last visit...which is a good thing.  I know it's not everyone taste, but the eclectic music choices make it a place with added ambiance.  Yes, it is on the expensive side, but it's worth it.
author: Carlos C.

description:
Eight dollars for a huge cheeseburger and some tasty fries (cooked in peanut oil!).  It's worth it.  Why?

First, the meat is from Niman Ranch (humanely slaughtered, vegetarian fed, no hormones)!  

Second, if you ask for a medium-rare burger, you'll get a perfectly-cooked medium-rare burger!  

Third, delicious!  

The portion sizes are large, and I found myself wishing that I'd ordered the mini cheeseburger ($6.45), so that I'd have room for a root beer float.  The milkshakes are excellent and I found the service to be rather friendly.

I love this place!
author: Arborvitae T.

description: This is probably the best burger I've had in this city. And that says a lot, because I've eaten a lot of burgers here. I eat at this place every Saturday night on my way to work. Burgers are tasty and the fries are scrumptious (fried in peanut oil, so they have a slight nutty flavor! yum!) They are going for an old retro-type feel (as in the 50's/60's) by the decor and music. I like the music, because you never hear the true oldies these days. fun. My only complaints is.. 10 dollars for my meal? I mean, it's real food, not fast-food, but seems a tad steep. Maybe I'm asking too much. And the "cash only" has been a problem for me before. Especially since the nearest ATM is at a corner store across the street and it charges you to use it (like most dumb ATMs). But as far as the food goes A+.
author: Michael M.

description: Neiman ranch meat makes for really great burgers.  It is their french fries that I can't seem to find a match for.  The owners live across the street from me and I have been trying to get him to tell my the secret and he just says they are fresh potatoes and we soak them before we fry them.
author: John T.

description:
The hamburger was good enough.  The fries were ok.  The iced tea was excellent but the chocolate milkshake was awful.  

It is a bit pricey -- $25 for two hamburgers and drinks.
author: Karen B.

description: This is the place to get fries in the bay area, even the stand at SFO will serve up better fries than most places...must be the peanut oil.  The burgers are good as well but don't get them any lighter than medium, the burger will wind up being tasteless.  I haven't been in that area for the while, when did they raise the price?  Definitely come for the fries and then head to Tartines for some dessert afterwads.
author: Ryan L.

description: The problem with this place is that they don't have A-1 and they won't give you the side car when you order a milk shake. Obviously it's run by people who don't know jack shit about what a burger joint is suppose to be like.
author: Brian B.

description: Way overpriced for something not that exciting.... I thought I  might have to take out a mortgage because I wanted fries and a soda. Interesting decor and concept, but not interested in going back.
author: j s.

description:
Burp!
Nothing hits the mini-spot better than a mini cheeseburger combo and a coca-cola!
author: betty r.

description: When I was pregnant all I wanted to eat were burgers. I became a burger connoisseur if you will. I ended up limiting myself to no more than one a week. I know that sounds gross but what can I say? I was pregnant and hungry all the time. One time I  called my husband at work crying because I was so hungry and didn't know what to do about it. He was already driving home so he couldn't bring me any of his scrumptious and delightful food, so at 11:30 at  night he stopped to get me some tacos in the mission on his drive home. (He was a very good daddy to be) Anyways despite his attempts I was really kinda disappointed that it wasn't a burger. I later convinced him  to do burger wed. at work. So besides my husbands burgers, Burger joint burgers are in my top three favorites. They use Niman ranch beef, they get the temperatures right, and the fries are some of the best in the city. And for the ladies trying to watch their waist line, or for the kids, they have mini burgers and  fries that taste just as good but are a smaller portion. I also enjoy the atmosphere, with the red booths, the stenciled walls, and the juke box-ish music. A modern version of an all American fifties diner. Love it.
author: Esa Y.

description: Yummy burgers and shakes. A simple menu, but good stuff!
author: RED L.

description:
the meal:
cheeseburger no bun sub ice tea for fries

the good:
walking distance from my house, no wait, they have sweet n low

the bad:
not a great value, unfriendly service, very limited selection

the ugly:
tries to be in-n-out without the value, service, or speed...i won't be going back.
author: Bubba M.

description: amazing cheeseburgers and fries.  a little pricey but it's okay to treat yourself too :)
author: Rochelle E.

description: Went here yesterday for lunch and thought it was a very good burger. Liked the many choices for fries too.  No frills here, just a tasty burger
author: Thad M.

description: Decent burgers, but the malts left something to be desired.  What's a burger joint without quality malts?  And if not malts, beer?  No beer!!?
author: J R.

description: great cure for a hangover!! The shakes are amazing and the burgers....droool!
author: Stephanie R.

description: Good fries but...what kind of burger place has no bacon?? Also, the cook thinks medium and rare are just another way of saying well done.
author: Steve P.

description: The burger was good, cooked to requested done-ness.  The mandatory fries were a bit overdone - or kinda too greasy and crunchy.  The prices were good so we didn't mind.  Overall, if I was hankering for a burger, I would definitely make another stop here.
author: Sheila K.

description: the bombest meat, fat fries and thick shakes...i LOVE IT, i LOVE IT, I LUV it!
author: Paul P.

description: I had the garden burger and fries.  It was very good.  Loved the artwork on the walls as well.
author: jennifer h.

description: This is my fave place that uses Niman Ranch for their burgers. It's amazing how many places use NR and yet the burgers all taste different so it must be how they are cooked. They are $2 cheaper than Burger Meister and taste better because they aren't charred to death. I mean, why use NR if you're going to cook it so well done it looks like leather!  I'm not a fan of the fries though since they're more like steak fries. When I tell them I want my burger cooked medium, that's exactly what I get. Plus they give you free refills on your drinks.  I've always had a good meal and quick service at both locations.
author: Gemma B.

description: Not cheap but oh so good.  Fries are lovely and the root beer float takes me back to childhood bliss when I'm feeling indulgent.
author: Casey J.
